metadata.title: CVE-2024-43872 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/hns: Fix soft lockup under heavy CEQE loadCEQEs are handled in interrupt handler currently. This may cause theCPU core staying in interrupt context too long and lead to soft lockupunder heavy load.Handle CEQEs in BH workqueue and set an upper limit for the number ofCEQE handled by a single call of work handler.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
